column3: 17}}, p.64</ref> and its alternative forms '''''-mar, -bar''''', means "house, home, dwelling, family" in [[Quenya]].

column1: It also refers to a "House" as in "family line, dynasty" (cf. [[Mardil
column2: Mardil Voronwë]]), or poetically to the world (cf. [[Ambar]]).

column1: * ''[[The Languages of Tolkien's Middle-earth]]'' by [[Ruth S. Noel]]
* [http://www.uib.no/People/hnohf/qlist.htm Quenya Corpus Wordlist] edited by [[Helge Fauskanger]]

[[Helge Fauskanger]] believes that ''már'' is unlikely to have the stem-form ''mard-'' and that the root resulted to '''two''' words: ''már (mar-)'' for "home, house", whereas ''mar (mard-)'' for "earth, world".<ref>{{webcite
